title: Augusta County: Thaddeus A. Hatcher to Mary Anna Sibert, December 24, 1861
summary: Thaddeus Hatcher writes to Mary Sibert about the death of his cousin Clinton Hatcher. He mentions a tribute to be published in the Washingtonian, the particulars of his fatal injury in battle, and his last words. Hatcher promises to send copies of the tribute to Sibert and to plant a rose as she requested.
keywords: Battle Description, Death/Casualties, Family, Patriotism, Women, American Civil War
